items.q: Physiognomists believe that the face can ____ personality characteristics. a. reveal b. hide c. deny d. pretend to have
Dr. Gall's research into phrenology was often ____ by other doctors. a. ridiculous b. ridiculed c. ridicule d. ridicules
In physiognomy, a person with an aquiline nose was believed to be self-centered and ____. a. arrogant b. arrogance c. arrogantly d. arrogants
Phrenology is the study of ____. a. tattoos on the body b. bumps on the arm c. bumps on the head d. lines on the face
Physiognomists think a person with a long pointed chin ____. a. shows strength of character b. likes to give orders c. has an artistic nature d. is very stern

Which of the following is not true? a. Pet owners have lower cholesterol. b. Pet owners live longer after a heart attack. c. Pet owners have fewer cases of cancer. d. Pet owners have fewer doctor visits.

Which sentence has correct punctuation? a. Traditional medical approaches such as surgery are still popular. b. Traditional medical approaches, such as, surgery are still popular. c. Traditional medical approaches, such as surgery are still popular. d. Traditional medical approaches, such as surgery, are still popular .
If people say you have a prominent nose, they mean your nose is ____. a. short b. ugly c. noticeable d. small
The body paragraphs in an essay each contain ____. a. more than one main idea b. only one main idea c. many main ideas d. no main ideas

Which sentence does not contain correct punctuation? a. Alternative medical treatments, such as acupuncture, are very popular. b. Treatments, such as acupuncture, are now very popular. c. Conventional medicine, uses the usual treatments such as surgery. d. Conventional medicine uses conventional treatments, such as pharmacological drugs.
In body paragraphs, use the phrase ____ before your most important example a. an additional example b. for instance c. the most significant example d. for example

Which is a correct sentence? a. For example, acupuncture. b. For instance, many treatments are used. c. For instance many people and conventional treatments. d. For example, treatments for holistic medicine.
Which animal is not mentioned in the reading? a. dog b. horse c. cat d. turtle
In phrenology, a person with a bump behind the curve of the ear is ____ person. a. a depressed b. an arrogant c. an adventurous and courageous d. a generous
Acupuncture has been very ____ in treating some forms of chronic pain. a. success b. successes c. successfully d. successful
The teacher gave me a stern look. Here, stern means _____. a. unsmiling b. silly c. questioning d. intelligent
If your boss fired you for no reason, you would feel _____. a. prominent b. brave c. loyal d. bitter
A smile usually indicates that someone is happy. Here, indicates means _____. a. asks b. denies c. shows d. pretends
Humility is a positive character _____. a. bulge b. trait c. belief d. activity
The company’s _____ meant that several people would lose their jobs. a. decide b. deciding c. decision d. decides
New York City drivers must have a lot of _____. a. courageous b. courage c. courageously d. courages
There is _____ proof that smoking causes cancer. a. science b. sciences c. scientific d. scientifically

A nursing home is _____. a. a place where retired nurses live b. a place where people go before they go to a hospital c. a place where people go after they leave a hospital d. a place where nurses working in a hospital live
The overall health of the population is getting worse. The word overall means _____. a. general b. mental c. physical d. past
If you cope with something, you _____. a. enjoy it b. survive it c. ignore it d. change it
If a treatment does wonders for someone, it _____. a. confuses the person b. causes the person to ask questions c. doesn’t surprise the person d. helps the person a lot
People usually pet _____. a. medicine b. clothing c. animals d. food
If you can’t detect a problem, _____. a. you can’t forget it b. you can’t see it c. you can’t understand it d. you can’t solve it
The _____ of disease is one of the most important jobs a doctor performs. a. detective b. detection c. detected d. detects
Red eyes usually _____ that the person is not well. a. significant b. signify c. significantly d. signifies
The doctor _____ Lisa for a sore throat. a. treating b. treatment c. treat d. treated
Children who own pets are less likely to be involved in sports.
Emotionally disturbed children should not be given pets.
Dogs are sometimes used to detect cancer.
Whenever you use the words such as , always use a comma.
In an example essay, only one body paragraph has examples to support the thesis statement.
For example and e.g . have the same meanings.
Dolphins make sounds that heal people.
If you detect something, you find it.
Each body paragraph in an essay has a different controlling idea.
You can begin a sentence with the words such as and then an example.
The ancient Greeks tried to understand human personalities by comparing human faces with animal faces.
Phrenologists were more interested in health than in personality.
Some alternative medical treatments such as foot reflexology are not as popular as acupuncture.
For example holistic doctors might recommend massage to relieve a headache.
Some forms of alternative medical treatments, such as herbs, have been used for hundreds of years.
Techniques to understand personality e.g. phrenology have always been very popular.
Complete systems of determining the reasons for personality characteristics for example astrology have captured people's attention through the centuries.
Brainstorm three ideas you might use in your essay.
Write a thesis statement for your essay.
